message:
"Power's Paradox"


Uninvited, Spring in occupied soil blooms,
Rigid ice melts into fractured votes.
Fear’s hijacked thrones, now apish in assent,
Yet, people blossom, defying remnant winter coats.
Invisible ink - scripted in bold defiance,
Freedom's seeds in oppression’s penance, floats.
prompt: Russia-Ukraine war at a glance: what we know on day 655 Ukraine condemned Russian plans to hold presidential elections next spring on occupied territory, declaring them “null and void” and pledging to prosecute any observers sent to monitor them. Russia’s upper house set the country’s presidential election this week for next March, and chair Valentina Matviyenko said residents in four occupied Ukrainian regions would be able to vote for the first time.
